title: Akbar
summary: Abu'l-Fath Jalal-ud-din Muhammad Akbar[7] (Persian: ابو الفتح جلال الدين محمد اكبر‎; 25 October 1542[lower-alpha 1] – 27 October 1605),[10][11][12] popularly known as Akbar the Great[13] (Persian: اکبر اعظم‎, romanized: Akbar-i-azam), and also as Akbar I (IPA: [əkbər]),[14] was the third Mughal emperor, who reigned from 1556 to 1605. Akbar succeeded his father, Humayun, under a regent, Bairam Khan, who helped the young emperor expand and consolidate Mughal domains in India.
